title: Anti-hyperglycaemic effect and nutritional properties of an aqueous extract of Larrea divaricata Cav. (jarilla) in streptozotocin-induced diabetes in mice.
abstract: Larrea divaricata Cav. (Zygophyllaceae) (jarilla) is a native plant of South America widely distributed across Argentina and used in popular medicine to treat diabetes and hypercholesterolemia by the Diaguita-Calchaquí, Amaichas, and Quilmes indigenous communities and by non-indigenous population (criollos) of Calamuchita, in the province of Córdoba, Argentina. L. divaricata has also proved to have anti-inflammatory properties. However, the antidiabetic effects and the nutritional properties of the aqueous extract (AE) of this plant remain to be scientifically determined.
